content.protection: 9 draws. Bring an extra just in case.
content.location: Located in the cirque right of Sea Monkey. Hike or climb to the top of Pitch 2 of Motorboating then follow the third class ledge to your left into the cirque. It’s on the right side of the cirque. Don’t confuse it with Aquawoman. You will pass Aquawoman on your way to the base of Waterdog.

climbs.name: Ursula
climbs.fa: Garett Collier, John Knight, Ian Ahoula

content.description: Bolted pitch above Aquaman. Steep with a few tricky moves. Well protected.
content.location: Follow the directions to the base of Aquaman. Climb Aquaman and belay from the top of that pitch. I posted this separately since the grade is so different.

content.description: Nice, easy, clean, safe route. Everything a beginning leader might want first time on the sharp end. Crux comes at the last clip before the anchors. Might be 5.7 if you head left or right of the bolt line. From the anchor you should be able to make up your own TR variations.
content.protection: Bring 6 or 7 draws and clip away.
content.location: To get there, take the Jim Thompson trail from Midgley Bridge parking area and continue along the base of the "Submarine/Steamboat Rock" feature. The cleanest approach is to head up to the top of Pitch 2 on Motorboating and work your way south along the big ledge until you find a "cirque". Scramble up/through some Class 3 to the base of the climb and the first bolt.

content.protection: 8 draws. I think. Bring an extra just in case.
content.location: Climb or hike to the top of Pitch 2 of Motorboating. Walk the 3rd Class Ledge and look for a line of bolts just before you get to the cirque where Sea Monkey starts.

content.description: Fun, relatively easy climb with a sustained series of 5.7/5.8 moves. The crux is likely near the bottom but the moves will keep you paying attention the entire way. Follow the bolted line and resist the urge to go left or right onto what seems like "easier" but "unclean" terrain. A fun outing and a great place to take beginning climbers. Start off on Sea Monkey (right of Aquaman) for an easy warmup.
content.protection: Bolted, 8 draws. Just clip and go.
content.location: About 50' left (climbers left) of Sea Monkey in the Cirque. See pic with topo map. To get to Sea Monkey and Aquaman, you'll need to work your way to the top of Pitch 2 of Motorboating. You can climb the first two pitches or simply hike up to the right and then work your way left on a big ledge.

content.description: Mostly sunny, east facing cirque with several bolted sport/slab climbs from 5.6 to 5.10.
